title: Express Talk: The Bartlett Collection of Post-Impressionism
hero_caption: <p>Georges Seurat, <em>A Sunday on La Grande Jatte — 1884</em>, 1884/86. Helen Birch Bartlett Memorial Collection.</p>
description:
In 1926, Frederic Clay Bartlett gave an astounding collection of Post-Impressionist paintings to the Art Institute in memory of his second wife, Helen Birch. Join educator Nenette Luarca-Shoaf for a 30-minute talk to explore the work of Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec and Georges Seurat, as well as learn about these forward-looking collectors.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
